**Fact 3** 
<br /> $i \in [m;n]$
<br /> $m \le n$
<br /> $N_{i}$=?
<br /> n-(m-1)=n-m+1

```{r}
count <- function(m, n){
length((m+1):(n-1))
}
count(-10,90)
```

Recall that an integer is one of the numbers in the list:
```{r}
-5:5
``` 

Which integers are between 1 and 10?
```{r}
2:9
```

**Fact 1**
<br /> m=1
<br /> n>0
<br /> $i \in [1;n]$
<br /> $N_{i}$=?
<br /> $N_{i}$=n

```{r}
count <- function(m, n){
length(m:n)
}
count(1,924310)
``` 

Think of an integer i with:
$i \in [1;10]$
```{r}
sample(x=c(1:10),             #integers to choose from
       size=1                 #the number of integers to choose
       )
```
Install package sets:
```{r}
install.packages('sets')
library('sets')
```

$i \in [-8;10]$
<br /> $N_{i}$=?
```{r}
even_seq = seq(-8,10,by=2)
even_seq
length(even_seq)
```
